You are correct, carbon offsetting should not be viewed as a substitute for meaningful emissions reductions. Companies should still focus on reducing their own carbon emissions in addition to investing in carbon offset programs. Investing in projects to offset carbon emissions should be viewed as part of a broader sustainability strategy, rather than a way for companies to absolve themselves of responsibility for their emissions.

It is crucial for companies to prioritize reducing their carbon emissions at the source, implement sustainable practices, and continuously monitor and improve their processes. Investing in carbon offset programs should be seen as a supplemental measure to this essential work.

In essence, carbon offsetting is not a perfect solution, but it can be a valuable contribution to addressing the problem of climate change.
